snippet: Hosni Mubarak, Egypt’s former president, appeared to display new confidence in court, or perhaps a certain schadenfreude, as he appeared at a hearing to open his retrial.
abstract: Former Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak appears confident and satisfied at court hearing to open his retrial on charges related to killing of protesters; Judge Mustafa Hassan Abdullah recuses himself citing conflict of interest, presumably because he had ruled in related cases.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: Hosni Mubarak, Egypt’s former president, appeared to display new confidence in court, or perhaps a certain schadenfreude, as he appeared at a hearing to open his retrial.

headline.seo: Mubarak, More Confident, Appears in Court in Cairo
headline.main: Mubarak Appears at Trial, Which Ends Abruptly in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Mubarak, Displays Apparent Confidence in Court

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
